# Chat Conversation

Note: _This is purely the output of the chat conversation and does not contain any raw data, codebase snippets, etc. used to generate the output._

### User Input

Create a browser-based atmospheric mystery puzzle game called “The Signal From Below.”

Game Style:
- Top-down perspective
- Slight pixel-art aesthetic
- Dark neon 80s-inspired color palette
- Minimal UI
- Playable on desktop and mobile browser

Core Gameplay:
The player explores a small town map and must restore 5 broken signal nodes.

Each node contains a simple puzzle:
- Light pattern memory match
- Radio frequency tuning mini-game
- Wire connection puzzle
- Symbol alignment puzzle
- Morse code decoding

Game Mechanics:
- 10-minute countdown timer
- Random distortion events every 90 seconds
- During distortion:
    - Screen colors shift to dark red/blue
    - Vines overlay on environment
    - Shadow creature roams faster
    - Player movement slightly slowed

Player:
- Simple character with flashlight cone
- WASD / touch controls
- Cannot attack creature
- Must avoid being touched (lose 1 life, 3 lives total)

Win Condition:
Restore all 5 signal nodes before timer ends.

Loss Condition:
Lose all lives OR timer reaches zero.

Atmosphere:
- Soft synth background music
- Subtle glitch sounds
- Occasional radio whisper audio cues

Easter Eggs (Subtle, Not Named):
- Waffle box in kitchen
- D20 dice in basement
- Arcade leaderboard name “MADMAX”
- Missing person flyer with red-haired silhouette
- Wall drawing of portal crack

Keep mechanics simple and modular.
Ensure mobile compatibility.
Focus on replayability.
